subclassFeature.name: Circle of the Air
entries: Flexible as the wind's currents, druids of the Circle of the Air manipulate their namesake with practised ease, serving as emissaries and stewards of the sky itself.

subclassFeature.name: Circle Spells
entries: You are imbued with the air's magics. When you reach certain Druid levels, you gain access to the spells in the table below. They count as Druid spells for you, and you always have them prepared, but they don't count against the total number of spells you prepare each day.

subclassFeature.name: Gale Talisman
entries: You possess a talisman that strengthens your bond with the wind. It is a Tiny object and can serve as a spellcasting focus for your Druid spells. You determine its form by rolling on the table below or by choosing one.

entries.caption: Gale Talisman
rows: A handheld fan engraved with breeze patterns
A necklace with an iridescent feather centrepiece
A global map of the wind's speed and direction
A wooden rod adorned with paper streamers
A bracelet made of dandelion stems and puffballs
A translucent bottle filled with swirling clouds

entries: While holding this talisman, you have these benefits:

items: You know {@spell gust|xge}. It has a range of 60 feet, can push creatures and objects in any direction instead of away from you, and can affect creatures of any size. A willing creature can choose to fail the spell's save.

Whenever you push a target using {@spell gust|xge}, you can also make it inflict {@dice 1d8} bludgeoning or slashing damage. This damage increases by 1d8 when you reach 5th level (2d8), 11th level (3d8), and 17th level (4d8).
You can cast a Circle Spell that you have access to without expending a spell slot. Once you do so, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.
If you lose this talisman, you can perform a 1-hour ceremony to magically create a replacement. This ceremony can be performed during a short or long rest, and it destroys the previous talisman.

subclassFeature.name: Tailwind
entries: The winds bolster your magic's capabilities. When you cast a Circle Spell, you can expend a Wild Shape usage to maintain it without {@condition concentration}. The spell ends early if you recast or dismiss it (no action required).

Additionally, whenever a creature comes into contact with a {@spell wind wall} you create, you can force it to succeed on a Strength saving throw or be unable to pass through the wall until the start of its next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Bend the Breeze
entries: The air moves however you command it. When you cast {@spell control winds|xge}, you alter its effects in the following ways:

entries.name: Gusts
entries: When a creature starts its turn in this area, you can force it to make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, you push it up to 15 feet in the wind's direction.

entries.name: Downdraft
entries: When a creature comes into contact with this area for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there, you can force it to succeed on a Strength saving throw or fall {@condition prone}.

entries.name: Updraft
entries: You can use your bonus action to grant any willing creatures of your choice within this area a magical flying speed of 30 feet until the end of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Embodiment of Air
entries: Your connection to the sky and everything in its domain reaches its peak. You add {@spell investiture of wind|xge}, {@spell scatter|xge}, {@spell wind walk}, and {@spell whirlwind|xge} to your list of Circle Spells.
